data.title: Rodney J. Ophoven
data.text:
A Funeral Service will be held at 10:00 AM on Tuesday, November 19, at Westwood Community Church, for Rodney J. Ophoven, 68, of St. Joseph. Rodney died at his home on November 13, 2013, with his loving family at his side. Pastor Steve Schoepf will officiate. Burial will be in the St. Joseph’s Parish Cemetery in St. Joseph.

Visitation will be from 4:00 – 8:00 PM on Monday and from 9:00-10:00 AM on Tuesday both at Westwood Church in St. Cloud. A time for sharing will be held at 7:00 P.M. Monday at the church. Arrangements are with the Daniel Funeral Home, St. Cloud.

Rodney was born on July 24, 1945 in St. Cloud to Sylvester and Leona (Otto) Ophoven. He attended St. Anthony’s grade school, and graduated from Tech High School in 1963. He served in the US Army as a medic in Vietnam from 1965-1967. He married Janet Kerzman on September 12, 1970 at Assumption Church in Eden Valley, MN. Rodney graduated from the St. Cloud School of Nursing in 1975. He was a R.N. at the VA for 30 years, retiring in 2011. Rodney was a member of Westwood Community Church for over 30 years. His love for the Lord inspired him to be actively involved in his church where he held many leadership roles and hosted bible studies in his home. Rodney was a loving husband, father and was an especially devoted grandfather. He was an avid gardener, a voracious reader and was known for his witty sense of humor.

Rodney is survived by: wife Janet; sons Jason (Krista), Curtis (Tracy), Daniel (Tonia), Timothy (Alyssa); 13 wonderful grandchildren; brothers David (Jean), Michael, Allen (Lois).

He was preceded in death by his parents.

Rodney’s family would like to extend special thanks to Quiet Oaks Hospice, the St. Cloud Hospital Hospice, and family, friends and neighbors that supported us.
